messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Solar System help
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, What we did was take some styrofoam balls of different sizes and paint them up, then hung them from the ceiling in his room.  As we painted each one, I
messages.messageBody:
Hi,

What we did was take some styrofoam balls of different sizes and paint them
up, then hung them from the ceiling in his room. As we painted each one, I
described what it looked like and where in reference to the earth it was
along with what it was made from. It made a great day of both crafting and
learning, and since he helped he was more attentive during the project.

Patti


At 12:20 AM 2/20/01, you wrote:
>I am interested in starting a project with my 5yo son. He has been asking
>?'s lately about the sun, moon, etc., and I thought that it might help things
>along if we made a model of the solar system. Something simple, I don't want
>him to lose interest :-) Any ideas for me?
>
>April C.

messages.subject: Solar System help

messages.messageBody:
I am interested in starting a project with my 5yo son. He has been asking
?'s lately about the sun, moon, etc., and I thought that it might help things
along if we made a model of the solar system. Something simple, I don't want
him to lose interest :-) Any ideas for me?

April C.
